cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 127 (Friday, August 2, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. DONALDS:H.J. Res. 195.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Art 1, Sec 8The single subject of this legislation is:To Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by theBureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to ``Truthin Lending (Regulation Z); Use of Digital User Accounts toAccess Buy Now, Pay Later Loans''[Page H4975]

item.title: Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to "Truth in Lending (Regulation Z); Use of Digital User Accounts to Access Buy Now, Pay Later Loans".

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
